Name: 1735 Poor-House Engraving
Caption: The poor-house erected in 1735, on the site of the present City Hall. From The New York Public Library.
Description: Wood engraving of first poor house in New York City, built in 1735 on the Commons, where City Hall is now
Citation: The Miriam and Ira D. Wallach Division of Art, Prints and Photographs: Print Collection, The New York Public Library. "The poor-house erected in 1735, on the site of the present City Hall." The New York Public Library Digital Collections. https://digitalcollections.nypl.org/items/510d47da-f37f-a3d9-e040-e00a18064a99

Name: 1809 Lithograph of Bridewell Prison and City Hall
Caption: Lithograph from 1809 showing buildings in City Hall Park: a shool, an engine house, Bridewell Prison, and City Hall. From The New York Public Library.
Description: Lithograph from 1809 showing a school, an engine house, Bridewell Prison, and City Hall within City Hall Park
Citation: The Miriam and Ira D. Wallach Division of Art, Prints and Photographs: Print Collection, The New York Public Library. "View of buildings in the park, N.Y., 1809. School, engine house, bridewell, City Hall" The New York Public Library Digital Collections. 1860. https://digitalcollections.nypl.org/items/5e66b3e9-172c-d471-e040-e00a180654d7

Name: 1910 Map of City Hall Park Showing Former Structures
Caption: From The New York Public Library
Description: Map of City Hall Park from 1910 detailing both the current and past structures in and around this area of New York City
Citation: Lionel Pincus and Princess Firyal Map Division, The New York Public Library. "A landmark map of City Hall Park" The New York Public Library Digital Collections. 1910. https://digitalcollections.nypl.org/items/8b467fe0-f78e-0130-4e54-58d385a7b928
